SEARCH
Module OOP
Package OOPProject

Interface MedicalRecordService

All Known Implementing Classes:
MedicalRecordServiceImpl
public interface MedicalRecordService
The MedicalRecordService interface defines the contract for managing medical records within the hospital system. It provides methods for adding and updating medical records associated with patients, diagnoses, treatments, and prescriptions.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addMedicalRecord(String recordID, Patient patient, Diagnosis diagnosis, Treatment treatment, List<Prescription> prescriptions)
    Adds a new medical record to the system.
    void
    updatePatientRecords(String recordID, String PatientID, Diagnosis diagnosis, Treatment treatment, List<Prescription> prescriptions)
    Updates an existing medical record in the system.

  • Method Details

    • addMedicalRecord

      void addMedicalRecord(String recordID, Patient patient, Diagnosis diagnosis, Treatment treatment, List<Prescription> prescriptions)
      Adds a new medical record to the system.
      Parameters:
      recordID - The unique identifier for the medical record.
      patient - The Patient associated with the medical record.
      diagnosis - The Diagnosis associated with the medical record.
      treatment - The Treatment associated with the medical record.
      prescriptions - The list of Prescription objects associated with the medical record.

    • updatePatientRecords

      void updatePatientRecords(String recordID, String PatientID, Diagnosis diagnosis, Treatment treatment, List<Prescription> prescriptions)
      Updates an existing medical record in the system.
      Parameters:
      recordID - The unique identifier for the medical record to update.
      PatientID - The ID of the patient associated with the medical record.
      diagnosis - The updated Diagnosis for the medical record.
      treatment - The updated Treatment for the medical record.
      prescriptions - The updated list of Prescription objects for the medical record.
